author: Lizzie Porter
title: Virgin Atlantic hand luggage restrictions
text: How many pieces of luggage can I bring in the cabin with me? One. Size : 23 x 36 x 56 cm Weight : 10 kg. In Upper Class (business/first cabin), passengers may take two bags, weighing up to 16kg. Can I book a hold bag on a single leg, and travel hand-luggage only on the other? No. Virgin Atlantic says that hold baggage is included in your ticket, so if passengers book a return, they are entitled to baggage in both directions. If you don’t have anything to check in on one leg, then you don’t pay any less. Am I allowed any items in addition to my one cabin bag ? In addition to the cabin baggage allowances as above, Virgin Atlantic passengers may bring a handbag or pocket bag "as you would normally use it". The airline says this means that it should not be used to carry items that would otherwise go in the cabin bag. Passengers may also bring an overcoat, an umbrella or walking stick, a small camera and/or pair of binoculars, a "reasonable amount" of reading matter for the flight, a "small amount" of duty free goods, and headphones for using the in-flight entertainment system. Related Articles Thomas Cook hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 easyJet hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 The world’s coolest suitcase? 25 Nov 2014 Monarch cabin luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Anything else? Laptops cannot be carried separately from the cabin bag: they must either fit in the cabin bag, or be checked into the hold. Passengers cannot carry a garment bag as cabin baggage unless it falls within the dimension restrictions. In addition to their free check in luggage allowance, passengers travelling with children are allowed to bring a fully collapsible pushchair and car seat. See Virgin Atlantic's policies on cabin baggage here . Suggested suitcase: Quadrant L1 2 Wheel Cabin Suitcase Price: £90 Size: 55cm x 35cm x 20cm Details: antler.co.uk Luggage choice by Soo Kim
